title: Agatha Christie's Marple (2010-2011) Series 05 - 4 SD Episodes
description:
Agatha Christie's Marple (2010-2011) Series 05 - 4 SD Episodes


Series Description Courtesy Of:

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia <a href="
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Agatha_Christie's_Marple" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Agatha_Christie's_Marple</a>


Agatha Christie's Marple (or simply Marple) is a British ITV television series based on the books and short stories by British crime novelist Agatha Christie. The title character was played by Geraldine McEwan from the first to third series, until her retirement from the role, and by Julia McKenzie from the fourth series onwards.

Each series consists of four feature-length episodes, except series six which only has three episodes. The first six episodes were all adaptations of Miss Marple novels by Christie. Subsequent episodes were derived both from works featuring Miss Marple but also Christie novels that did not feature the character. The title of the series removes the word Miss from Miss Marple, to match the title of the Agatha Christie's Poirot series.

Following the conclusion of the sixth series, it was announced that the BBC had acquired the rights for the production of Agatha Christie adaptations, suggesting that ITV would be unable to make a seventh series of Marple.

2010-08-30 - The Pale Horse (Video:H264 624x336, 898kbps, 25fps - Audio:AAC 44.1kHz, 103kbps)

Miss MarpleÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s old friend Father Gorman is brutally murdered after visiting the dying Mrs Davis. When Miss Marple receives a mysterious list of names through the post, sent by Gorman moments before his death, she heads to London to investigate.  Detective Inspector Lejeune and Police Surgeon Edward Kerrigan puzzle over the killing. But when Lejeune dismisses MarpleÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s list she is determined to find justice for her friend.


2010-12-27 - The Secret of Chimneys (Video:H264 704x392, 901kbps, 29fps - Audio:AAC 44.1kHz, 106kbps)

Miss Marple finds herself spending the weekend at Chimneys, the stately home of Lord Caterham whose late wife was her cousin. The weekend has a diplomatic air to it as the Austrian Count Ludwig von Stainach is also there to negotiate a trade agreement with the British that will give the British access to iron ore. An important person goes missing, and Marple's search leads to a decades-old murder that might be connected to a mysterious diamond theft.


2010-12-29 - The Blue Geranium (Video:H264 704x392, 901kbps, 29fps - Audio:AAC 44.1kHz, 105kbps)

While visiting her friend Dermot in Little Ambrose, Miss Marple is drawn into investigating the apparently drowning of a recent acquaintance. Within a few days, a second occupant suspiciously dies from fright.


2011-01-02 - The Mirror Crack'd From Side To Side (Video:H264 704x392, 898kbps, 29fps - Audio:AAC 44.1kHz, 103kbps)

Hollywood star Marina Gregg leaves Los Angeles for the picturesque countryside of St Mary Mead. Having taken up residence at Gossington Hall with her dashing young English husband, film director Jason Rudd, his secretary, Ella Blunt and Marina's exclusive personal assistant, Hailey Preston, it's not long before she becomes lady of the manor.  But when a local fan, Heather Badcock consumes a poisoned daiquiri, Marina finds herself starring in a real-life mystery - supported by Miss Marple and Inspector Hewitt, who suspect that the lethal cocktail was intended for someone else.
